intro: Lupinus aliclementinus, commonly known as the Clementine lupine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of vibrant blue to purple pea-shaped flowers. The plant produces cylindrical seed pods that contain several small, hard seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Lupinus aliclementinus is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which benefits the surrounding soil ecosystem.
